Package com.sinch.xms

Class ApiConnection.Builder

java.lang.Object
com.sinch.xms.ApiConnection.Builder
Enclosing class:
ApiConnection
public static class ApiConnection.Builder
extends Object
A builder of API connections. At a minimum the service plan identifier and authentication token must be set.

  • Method Details

    • endpoint

      public ApiConnection.Builder endpoint​(String url)
      Initializes the endpoint from the given URL string. The URL should not contain query or fragment components.
      Parameters:
      url - the URL to the XMS endpoint
      Returns:
      this builder for use in a chained invocation

    • build

      public ApiConnection build()
      Builds a new, initially stopped, ApiConnection. Before attempting to interact with XMS it is necessary to start the returned connection, this is done using ApiConnection.start().

      The start() method is recommended for the common case where the built ApiConnection is immediately started.

      Returns:
      a freshly built API connection
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if any required attributes are missing

    • start

      public ApiConnection start()
      Builds and starts the defined API connection. This is identical to calling build() and then immediately calling ApiConnection.start() on the generated connection object.
      Returns:
      an API connection

    • using

      @CanIgnoreReturnValue public final ApiConnection.Builder using​(ApiConnection instance)
      Fill a builder with attribute values from the provided ApiConnection instance. Regular attribute values will be replaced with those from the given instance. Absent optional values will not replace present values.
      Parameters:
      instance - The instance from which to copy values
      Returns:
      this builder for use in a chained invocation

    • token

      @CanIgnoreReturnValue public final ApiConnection.Builder token​(String token)
      Initializes the value for the token attribute.
      Parameters:
      token - The value for token
      Returns:
      this builder for use in a chained invocation

    • prettyPrintJson

      @CanIgnoreReturnValue public final ApiConnection.Builder prettyPrintJson​(boolean prettyPrintJson)
      Initializes the value for the prettyPrintJson attribute.

      If not set, this attribute will have a default value as returned by the initializer of prettyPrintJson.

      Parameters:
      prettyPrintJson - The value for prettyPrintJson
      Returns:
      this builder for use in a chained invocation
